item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "Often, moreover, it is...that aspect of our being that society finds eccentric, ridiculous, or disagreeable, that holds our sweet waters, our secret well of happiness, the key to our equanimity in malevolent climes." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by dave eggers
item.description: "We are unusual and tragic and alive." -- dave eggers

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by J. D. Salinger
item.description: "Anyway, I keep picturing all these little kids playing some game in this big field of rye and all. Thousands of little kids, and nobody's around - nobody big, I mean - except me. And I'm standing on the edge of some crazy cliff. What I have to do, I have to catch everybody if they start to go over the cliff - I mean if they're running and they don't look where they're going I have to come out from somewhere and catch them. That's all I do all day. I'd just be the catcher in the rye and all. I know it's crazy, but that's the only thing I'd really like to be." -- J. D. Salinger

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Bessie Anderson Stanley
Rebecca add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by e.e. cummings
item.description: "For whatever we lose (like a you or a me), It's always our self we find in the sea." -- e.e. cummings

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "Imperfection is beauty, madness is genius and it's better to be absolutely ridiculous than absolutely boring." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "I haven't the slightest idea how to change people, but still I keep a long list of prospective candidates just in case I should ever figure it out." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Charles M. Schulz
item.description: "Nothing takes the taste out of peanut butter quite like unrequited love." -- Charles M. Schulz

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Chuck Klosterman
item.description: "There are two ways to look at life. The first view is that nothing stays the same and that nothing is inherently connected, and that the only driving force in anyone's life is entropy. The second is that everything pretty much stays the same (more or less) and that everything is completely connected, even if we don't realize it." -- Chuck Klosterman

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Edith Wharton
item.description: "In spite of illness, in spite even of the archenemy sorrow, one can remain alive long past the usual date of disintegration if one is unafraid of change, insatiable in intellectual curiosity, interested in big things, and happy in small ways." -- Edith Wharton

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "We need more light about each other. Light creates understanding, understanding creates love, love creates patience, and patience creates unity." -- Malcolm X

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by steve martin
item.description: "I believe entertainment can aspire to be art, and can become art, but if you set out to make art you're an idiot." -- steve martin

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Not all of us can do great things. But we can do small things with great love." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Gene Wilder
item.description: "If you're not gonna tell the truth, then why start talking?" -- Gene Wilder

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Sloane Crosley
item.description: "Life starts out with everyone clapping when you take a poo and goes downhill from there. " -- Sloane Crosley

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "The world is a dangerous place to live, not because of the people who are evil, but because of the people who don't do anything about it." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "You must have chaos within you to give birth to a dancing star." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Jim Henson
item.description: "Simple is good." -- Jim Henson

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "Just don't take any class where you have to read BEOWULF." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Laurie Notaro
item.description: "Oh boy. Too drunk to hold on to a whiskey and Coke and the word "pretty." That's not a combination with a positive outcome. Not good at all. That's the secret password that usually leaves me trying to find a ride home in the morning." -- Laurie Notaro

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Rob Sheffield
item.description: "There are all kinds of mix tapes. there is always a reason to make one." -- Rob Sheffield

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Johnny Cash
item.description: "You build on failure. You use it as a stepping stone. Close the door on the past. You don't try to forget the mistakes, but you don't dwell on it. You don't let it have any of your energy, or any of your time, or any of your space." -- Johnny Cash

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Dave Eggers
item.description: "You invite things to happen. You open the door. You inhale. And if you inhale the chaos, you give the chaos, the chaos gives back." -- Dave Eggers

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Lynn Peril
item.description: "I have grown up to be many things, but dainty sure as hell isn't one of them." -- Lynn Peril

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "So we beat on, boats against the current, borne back ceaselessly into the past." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald
